feat.name: Description
feat.text: Male dwarf, 4'4", approx 150lbs, red hair and beard, amber eyes

feat.name: Languages
feat.text: Common, Draconic, Druidic, Dwarvish, Goblin, Primordial

feat.name: Darkvision
feat.text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

feat.name: Dwarven Resilience
feat.text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

feat.name: Dwarven Combat Training
feat.text: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, throwing hammer, and warhammer.

feat.name: Tool Proficiency
feat.text: You gain proficiency with the artisan’s tools of your choice: smith’s tools, brewer’s supplies, or mason’s tools.

feat.name: Stonecunning
feat.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

feat.name: (2) Wild Shape
feat.text:
You can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast you have seen before. Challenge rating up to lvl/3, minimum CR of 1.
You can use this feature twice. You can regain expended uses who you complete a short or long rest.
You can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half your Druid level (rounded down). You can revert to your normal form using a bonus action.
Retain alignment, personality, INT, WIS, CHA. Retain all skill and saving proficiencies, and gain those of animal. Take spillover damage past 0 into regular HP pool. Transforming doesn't break concentration.

feat.name: (2) Combat Wild Shape
feat.text:
You gain the ability to use Wild Shape as a bonus action.
While you are transformed by Wild Shape, you can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot to regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

feat.name: (6) Primal Strike
feat.text: Your attacks in beast form count as magical for the purpose of oncoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

feat.name: (10) Elemental Wild Shape
feat.text: You can expend two uses of Wild Shape at the same time to transform into an air, earth, fire, or water elemental.

feat.name: (14) Thousand Forms
feat.text: You can cast the Alter Self spell at will.

feat.name: (18) Beast Spells
feat.text: You can cast many of your Druid spells in any shape you assume using Wild Shape. You can perform the somatic and verbal components of a Druid spell while in beast shape, but you aren't able to provide martial components.

feat.name: (18) Timeless Body
feat.text: The primal magic that you wield causes you to age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body only ages one year.

feat.name: (20) Archdruid
feat.text:
You can use your Wild Shape an unlimited amount of times.
You can ignore the verbal and somatic components of your Druid spells, as well as any material components that lack a cost and aren't consumed by a spell. You gain this benefit in both your normal shape and your beast shape from Wild Shape.

feat.name: Weapon Proficiencies
feat.text: battle axe, darts, javelins, hand axe, mace, quarterstaff, scimitar, sickle, sling, spear, throwing hammer, war hammer

feat.name: Preparing And Casting Spells
feat.text: Prepare WIS + LVL number of spells

feat.name: Lost Band Of Ancestry
feat.text: Able to smell copper and silver, affinity for emeralds.

feat.name: Researcher
feat.text: When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature. Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.

feat.name: Background
feat.text: I wear a copper and silver band on my left arm above the elbow. I was left at a monastery deep in the forest as a toddler. I have no information of my family except for the family crest on the band. There are runes on the inside of the band that I've been unable to translate. Because the band is my only link to my family I have a strong attachment to it. So strong that I can smell the metals it's made from, due to a traumatic loss of the band when I was young. Until this event, the Druids at the monastery called me "Dwarf." This earned me the name "Cog," spelled Cuag for the runes of the metals in the band.

feat.name: Personality Trait
feat.text: I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I don't mind explaining things to others.

feat.name: Ideal
feat.text: The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge.

feat.name: Bond
feat.text: I've been searching my whole life to find information about my family.

feat.name: Flaw
feat.text: I have a fear of abandonment.

feat.name: Polearm Master
feat.text:
You can keep your enemies at bay with reach weapons. You gain the following benefits.
When you take the Attack action and attack with only a glaive, halberd, or quarterstaff, you can use a bonus action to make an attack with the opposite end of the weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage.
While you are wielding a glaive, halberd, pike, or quarterstaff, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you who they enter your reach.

item.name: Staff Of The Uncrowned King
item.text: Requires attunement

item.name: Mask Of The Braxat
item.text:
Mask, very rare, requires attunment
This mask is made from the brownish-orange facial chitin of a large insect, including the foremost of his cranial protrusions.
When activated, this mask enables the wearer to spit a globe of acid at an opponent up to 40 ft away.
DC is 10 + spell casting ability or DC + DEX if wearer doesn't cast spells.
The opponent takes 4d6 points of Acid damage on a hit and half on a successful save.
This ability functions three times per day.

item.name: Cloak Of Elvenkind
item.text:
Hide in any natural environment. Looks super bad ass.
This long cloak is fashioned from gray cloth, expertly crafted, and is half the weight of a normal cloak.
An elf who sees a non-elf wearing a cloak of this sort might assume the cloak is stolen. In some cases, however, cloaks of elvenkind are presented as gifts to the elves' most trusted and valued allies.
Property: While you wear a cloak of elvenkind with the hood up, you can attempt to hide in any natural environment, as long as no creatures are within 20 feet of you. You do not have to be obscured to make the attempt, but you must stay quiet.

item.name: Cursed Cave Walker Boots
item.text:
1/encounter, wearer can ignore effect that will change their position 1/day, traverse the wall or ceiling at half your speed Have a preference for being upside down when idle
Requires attunement

item.name: Magic Rune Stone
item.text: 1/encounter, lasts 5 min, chaotic effect, weapon +1 01-20 - additional +1 to weapon 21-40 - weap gains energy type of choice, +1D6 41-60 - 50% chance to add 1D12 damage 61-80 - weapon uses next damage die (6>8>10) 81-00 - reroll one miss

item.name: Eleven Ring Of Defense
item.text: 1/encounter reduce damage by 5

item.name: Ring Of Corners
item.text:
Able to see out of emerald if ring worn in the last hour. Won from stone-crushing contest.
Require attunment

item.name: Lost Longsword Of The Northern King
item.text:
Gives Sight Beyond Sight - 1/day can cast True Seeing for five minutes
Requires attunement

item.name: Boots Of Curb Stomping
item.text: 1d6 against enemy on the first round of damage if you charged

item.name: Dagger Of Venom +1
item.text:
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls for attacks you make with this magic weapon. If you apply poison to the dagger, other than its own poison, its saving throw DC increases by 2.
Once per day, you can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until you hit with an attack using this weapon. When you hit acreature with the poisoned dagger, the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes poisoned for 1 minute and takes 2d10 poison damage.

item.name: Starlight Light Crossbow +2
item.text: ATK d20+prof+dx+2 DMG d8+Dex+2

item.name: Erebus Hand Wraps (Shadow Ribbons)
item.text:
Makes you want to do slight of hand, always busy
Requires attunement

item.name: Cursed Ageis
item.text:
Strike to light shield 1/day 1 hit dice used gives max roll
Requires attunement

item.name: Amulet Of Health
item.text:
CON is 19 while wearing
Wondrous, requires attunement

item.name: Leather Armor +1
item.text: Enchanted by Krystoval Have a slight blue hue

item.name: Spider Leg, 6'
item.text: Taken from giant spider killed in theater

item.name: Book Of Teaching And Maps
item.text: Given to me by the Druids when I set off to find my history.

item.name: Candle
item.text: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

item.name: Component pouch
item.text: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell’s description).

item.name: Crowbar
item.text: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar’s leverage can be applied.

item.name: Crystoval's Book, Front Page
item.text: Torn out of the book before we destroyed it after killing the Lich Queen

item.name: Hempen rope (50 feet)
item.text: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

item.name: Herbalism kit
item.text: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing.

item.name: Mess kit
item.text: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

item.name: Rations (1 day)
item.text: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

item.name: Tinderbox
item.text: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

item.name: Torch
item.text: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

item.name: Vial Of Book Blood
item.text: Taken from the Lich Queen's book when destroyed by priestesses

item.name: Potions Of Inspiration
item.text: Gain advantage on rolls

item.name: Potion Of Longevity
item.text: Potion, very rare When you drink this potion, your physical age is reduced by 1d6 + 6 years, to a minimum of 13 years. Each time you subsequently drink a potion of longevity, there is 10 percent cumulative chance that you instead age by 1d6 + 6 years. Suspended in this amber liquid are a scorpion’s tail, an adder’s fang, a dead spider, and a tiny heart that, against all reason, is still beating. These ingredients vanish when the potion is opened.

item.name: Bag Of Holding
item.text: Wondrous item, uncommon This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate. Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a Heward’s handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can’t be reopened.

item.name: Scrimshaw Pipe With Copper Inlay
item.text: In the shape of Maradin's hammer

item.name: Vial Of Black Sizzle Water
item.text: Sizzle when pours in the ground

note.text: First time using this app, hopefully everything is set correctly. Working on switching character from Next to 5e.

note.name: Back notes before switching to app
note.text:
Kelani the singer, "more than what she seems," spy for concordium. elf queen embassy, stark gold, booby trapped captain "eye patch" Mandelbrot malin'tor spy master, Russian accent elf queen pendant ambassador Syra "Mrs Scissors" the wolf book in the spotlight room in the theatre Zanafer was zombie lady we killed Kelani stole cristoval's spell book (used to cause all kinds of problems) -day of morning, red waste haris of dragonhall is a spy! saiden boromor owns Lucky Lady, Vink's cousin Half a neckless, shifty eyes thora tarkanen, important and looked down upon unicorns are real 2nd down on right, straight through double door, middle door in round room then across the hallway
catholic power runes "pineapple" chipmunk, spoon, sugar, barefoot rustic rooster, capt william t portabel, loves seahorses, wants to protect sea life, fish tacos arlan twackdinger was a slave, kender, trained by same dude as Gav seafaring dwarf, tourtalina loved, rival dan corngrinder giant castle ship found lady aristine delborn, elvish, 100 years in captivity sank the ship with the bomb got cursed cave weaver boots
court of stars in elftown, captain william t portabel, smuggling us into the city. lady elf 200 years old moonshadow, ruler of the high elves dearborn, king of the 12th age loved the sizard king city of the coast, concord pack lord inn, say hi to breanna general thuram, giving to axis and publicly killing his daughter kelanie bounty for oni - demon spirits we killed a green drake! took two big fucking pointy teeth ben got snuck up on "dont move or i'll slit your throat" she is using a power "gav, you need to be on your guard my father is trying to kill you to steal the book, get to queens wood to be safe"
shannon gets to use his arm crystals for his casting focus ryan reworked sarah's character sheet heading to twisp, right side of hill, filled with halflings master sheply made 35 health potions fertile soils. well maintained, quiet atmosphere ancient waterfall cooking, blacksmithing, farming, rare animal husbandry familiar face "bob" female elf mage, met 7 years ago, while an engineer been desecration of local temple, work of diabloist, learn what it means enter the temple, crumbling, creepy disappear non human chanting - druid recognize as bullywog (frogs) dark unholy ritual, not arcana, peaceful dusk, normal weather have a good feeling the town might be okay we have achieved the court of stars a ring! elven ring of defense, broad silver band with emerald general therum takes a knee before king sister casts invisibility to hide from general beheaded his own daughter kelanie (after we brought her back from the dead) to make destroy book go see private performance from bard who mesmerized The Green Dragon, seen at The Badgers Harp. Connie Saltemie

note.name: Custom Attack Explanation
note.text:
Attack: d20 + Prof + WIS + 1 + 1 D20 roll to hit, plus proficiency, plus WIS instead of STR because Cantrip, plus 1 for active rune, plus 1 for "+1 quarterstaff", plus rune effect (only on 1-20)
Damage: d8 + WIS + 1 + 1 + 1 Weapon die (boosted by Cantrip), plus WIS instead of STR because Cantrip, plus 1 for active rune, plus 1 for "+1 quarterstaff", plus rune effect

trait.name: Echolocation
trait.text: The bat can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The bat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: If the boar takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can’t constrict another target.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can’t bite another target.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The frog can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The frog’s long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

monster.label: Giant Eagle
monster.name: Giant Eagle
monster.languages: Giant Eagle, understands Common and Auran but can’t speak them

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eagle makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
trait.text: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The owl doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The owl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The panther has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the panther moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The shark has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
